formattedAddress: 109 E 22nd St, New York, NY 10010, USA
adrFormatAddress: 109 E 22nd St, New York, NY 10010, USA

editorialSummary.text: Premium restaurant serving oysters, steak, seafood, and desserts, plus wine and a robust cocktail list.

originalText.text:
Beautiful space; nice people.

Disappointing food. Pretty but not great: salad heavy and tasteless; steak tough and gravy kind of sweet; ice cream good the other two desserts not so much.

Restaurant week bill for three with a bottle of Bojoulais was $335.

text.text:

originalText.text:
Hawksmoor NYC exceeded all expectations during my recent visit. My sister and I chose this establishment to celebrate our birthday, and it turned out to be an exceptional dining experience. We had bone marrow, lamb, lobster, steak, mac and cheese, creamed spinach, and a myriad of other mouthwatering dishes.

Our waiter, Jerry, played a pivotal role in enhancing our evening. Jerry was an expert in knowing the menu, making recommendations that complemented our preferences.

If you happen to be in the area, you should stop by!

text.text:
Hawksmoor NYC exceeded all expectations during my recent visit. My sister and I chose this establishment to celebrate our birthday, and it turned out to be an exceptional dining experience. We had bone marrow, lamb, lobster, steak, mac and cheese, creamed spinach, and a myriad of other mouthwatering dishes.

Our waiter, Jerry, played a pivotal role in enhancing our evening. Jerry was an expert in knowing the menu, making recommendations that complemented our preferences.

If you happen to be in the area, you should stop by!

originalText.text:
Bottom line - we've expected more flavor in our steaks

The full review -
It's a beautiful dining space
Our waiter was very knowledgeable and very professional and we liked him a lot
The cocktails were superb
The side of french fries was very good
The bone marrow starter was very/too heavy on the onions which overshadowed the flavor of the marrow
The toffee dessert was exceptionally good

So why only 3 stars?
Because the essence of this place (in my mind) and the number one reason for a visit is its steaks. And this is where they fall short
We've ordered the porterhouse and ribeye
The porterhouse was undercooked more towards MR than the requested M, but we can live with that
Where we were very disappointed, and all three of us agreed without trying to convince each other, was on the lack of flavor. It was simply noticeably absent from our cuts
We couldn't put our finger on it. You take a bite and it was pretty boring in your mouth and didn't really pull you towards taking another bite. It felt more like a chore to finish our food than something you savor

All in all, I would go someplace else for a top notch steak for this price point

originalText.text: I really wanted to like Hawksmoor. We were excited to visit however, it didn’t quite meet expectations in two categories: food and service. We had the bone marrow oysters which were very tasty and well presented. Their stuffing was mostly bread crumbs, it seemed. At their price point, they are pricey for what you get. We had the Sunday roast which we really looked forward to and our main reason for visiting. The presentation was authentic but it wasn’t up to par all around. The meat was well cooked and had excellent juicy flavor which had a charcoal fire roasted essence. The yorkshire was perfect.  The vegetables were fine and enjoyed the roasted garlic bowl on the dish. The offensive failure on this dish was the roasties. They were clearly cooked hours, if not a day earlier. They had ZERO crisp. They tasted reheated with a chewy soggy edge that made them difficult to cut. They were clearly old. They were inedible. It ruined the dish and really should never be served. We asked for english mustard which they had none but they did offer horseradish. English mustard is really an essential staple here. On the bright side, the bloody mary on the menu was the best i’ve ever had. The wine list was very pricey for even the most basic red. Sticky toffy pudding was tasty. Lastly, service was a bit of a let down. We felt rushed despite seeing open tables around us. We had half a bottle of wine left and our cocktail on the table and the bill was dropped off because the waitress said “since we didn’t need anything else”. So since we were done ordering, they wrapped up on our service and left us there to finish. While this would be fine at a fast food place, not acceptable at a high end restaurant/steakhouse. As we chatted over drinks, another server swooped by as we walked past us asking if we were done with the bill to which I replied “i’m not sure but i think so”… he did not give us a moment to look and just took it away. We finished our drinks and left; a poor experience. Total bill for two: $450

originalText.text: We have had 2 8-person group dinners and a 2 person dining experience here. The servers are friendly and helpful and the food is excellent. The steak could have a little bit more of a sear on the outside but the meat quality is great! The apps and sides as well as the peanut butter Louis dessert were all awesome. Definitely order the tomato salad and scotch bonnet oysters!
